reviewText: This DVD inspired me to throw away the rules (and rulers) when it comes to piecing. Ricky provides a goodly number of wonderful why-didn't-I-think-of-that techniques for getting creative with quilt design and construction. I love his ideas for getting smooth curves without pins. But his improvisational techniques are the best. So freeing! This DVD is professionally produced and I found it incredibly easy to follow all the techniques. I didn't think I was a visual learner (leaning much more toward books), until I started watching quilting DVDs. But my mind was changed by this one and it's follow-up covering quilting and finishing techniques: Ricky Tims Presents Grand Finale: Fine Machine Quilting and Finishing Techniques. And now he has yet another DVD out on quilting, which I think is totally amazing: Ricky Tims Kool Kaleidoscope.

While I won't make the project demonstrated in this video, I did learn a couple techniques I've already used on other quilts.

I think I would have gotten more use out of a book vs. the DVD.
